snippet: Mr. Buffett, chief of Berkshire Hathaway, responded to concern that he had abandoned his company’s moral compass by teaming with 3G, an investment firm known for ruthlessly cutting jobs.
abstract: Andrew Ross Sorkin DealBook column notes Berkshire Hathaway chairman and chief executive Warren E Buffett spoke at firm's latest annual meeting, which has become known as 'Woodstock for capitalists;' says he has teamed with Brazilian investment company 3G, characterized by ruthlessly eliminating jobs; points out Buffett runs fairly lean organization, despite hands-off management style.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Buffett, chief of Berkshire Hathaway, responded to concern that he had abandoned his company’s moral compass by teaming with 3G, an investment firm known for ruthlessly cutting jobs.

headline.print_headline: Berkshire’s Teddy Bear Can Have a Hard Nose
headline.main: Berkshire’s Warren Buffett Shows His Teddy Bear Image Has Tough Side
